decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with low-cost creatures and using cards like Resolute Reinforcements and Warleader's Call to buff them up for a powerful attack. It also includes removal spells like Gleeful Demolition to clear the way for an aggressive assault. The deck's mana base allows for consistent plays, with a mix of lands that provide white and red mana. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault, utilizing the synergy between creatures and spells to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quick, aggressive plays with low-cost creatures to overwhelm the opponent early on. The goal is to push damage through with creatures like Novice Inspector, Voldaren Epicure, and Knight-Errant of Eos, while using cards like Resolute Reinforcements and Warleader's Call to further boost the board presence. Additionally, the deck includes disruption and removal spells like Gleeful Demolition and Case of the Gateway Express to control the opponent's board. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy with a mix of red and white sources.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to establish board control through removal spells and counterspells, while also utilizing card advantage and graveyards synergies to outvalue the opponent. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy, protect its own threats, and grind out incremental advantages over time. The deck includes a mix of removal, counter spells, card draw, and land destruction to control the pace of the game and eventually win through out-valuing the opponent. The deck also utilizes a variety of lands to ensure consistent mana production and fixing.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of creature control and disruptive spells. Utilizing a combination of evasive creatures like Faerie Mastermind and efficient removal spells like Go for the Throat, the deck aims to maintain control of the board while pressuring the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Dennick, Pious Apprentice and Virtue of Loyalty allows for additional creature buffs and protection. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy while providing flexibility in color options. Overall, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and combat tricks. By applying early pressure with cards like Novice Inspector and Voldaren Epicure, the deck aims to close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. Resolute Reinforcements and Gleeful Demolition provide additional ways to push damage through and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a mix of aggressive creatures and removal spells, this deck aims to win the game through speed and efficiency.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with low-cost creatures like Novice Inspector and Warden of the Inner Sky, supported by cards like Resolute Reinforcements and Imodane's Recruiter for additional damage and aggression. The inclusion of cards like Gleeful Demolition and Case of the Gateway Express allow for removal of opponent's threats while maintaining pressure. The deck also includes a few high-impact cards like Anim Pakal, Thousandth Moon and Knight-Errant of Eos to finish off the opponent quickly. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle.

This deck focuses on using a variety of creatures and spells to apply constant pressure on the opponent, with a mix of flying and powerful abilities to quickly deplete their life total. It combines aggressive creatures like Faerie Mastermind and Deep-Cavern Bat with disruptive spells like Go for the Throat and No More Lies to control the board. It also includes powerful enchantments like Virtue of Loyalty to boost creatures and The Wandering Emperor to deal additional damage. The mana base is designed to provide a mix of colored sources for consistent casting of spells.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay by using a combination of low-cost creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to establish early board presence with cards like Crawling Chorus and Skrelv, Defector Mite, while utilizing spells like Fading Hope and Serum Snare to control the opponent's board. The deck also includes cards like Venerated Rotpriest and Jawbone Duelist to deal damage and maintain pressure. Additionally, cards like March of Swirling Mist and Bring the Ending provide additional support and removal options to keep the opponent on the back foot.

This Bant Aggro deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures such as Annex Sentry and Venerated Rotpriest. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Fading Hope and Serum Snare to control the board and protect your own creatures. March of Swirling Mist and Skrelv's Hive provide additional support for your creatures, while Bring the Ending offers a powerful removal option. The mana base includes a mix of lands to ensure consistent access to the deck's spells.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and spells while disrupting their strategy with removal and control cards. By combining evasion, card advantage, and powerful creatures, the Dimir Aggro deck aims to quickly take control of the game and secure a win before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The deck includes a mix of efficient creatures and powerful spells to provide a versatile and aggressive playstyle that can adapt to different matchups.

This deck focuses on filling the board with a variety of aggressive creatures and utilizing various spells to control the opponent's board while dealing consistent damage. Through a combination of powerful creatures like Faerie Mastermind and Raffine, Scheming Seer, along with removal spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The mana base is set up to ensure flexibility in casting spells of various colors while staying aggressive. The key to victory lies in maintaining board presence and applying pressure to force the opponent into a corner.

This deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays, utilizing a mix of creatures and spells to apply pressure to the opponent. The main strategy involves controlling the board with removal spells like Go for the Throat while also developing a board presence with creatures like Raffine, Scheming Seer and Faerie Mastermind. The deck also includes cards like Virtue of Loyalty to boost the team's power and resilience. With a mix of evasion, disruption, and card advantage, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays, using a combination of creature threats and removal spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. It includes a mix of powerful creatures with abilities that can disrupt the opponent's strategy, along with cards that can quickly deal with threats on the battlefield. The mana base is built to support a consistent aggressive game plan, with a mix of lands that allow for both early aggression and late-game staying power. The overall goal is to quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory through a combination of creature damage and disruption.

The deck focuses on utilizing a mix of control spells and powerful creatures to dominate the board and outvalue opponents. Cards like Memory Deluge and Fires of Victory provide card advantage and allow for efficient removal, while Nissa, Resurgent Animist and Shigeki, Jukai Visionary offer strong threats. Aftermath Analyst helps generate more resources, while Ill-Timed Explosion and Worldsoul's Rage can provide additional removal and finishers. The deck also includes lands like Brokers Hideout and Maestros Theater for extra utility and fixing. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and overwhelm opponents with its powerful synergies.

This UW Control deck focuses on stalling and controlling the game with cards like Memory Deluge, No More Lies, and March of Otherworldly Light. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Get Lost and Deduce, while also generating card advantage with Tishana's Tidebinder and Phantom Interference. The deck also includes a mix of lands to ensure mana consistency and utility. Overall, the key strategy is to outlast the opponent and slowly grind out a win through attrition and card advantage.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using powerful creature cards like Topiary Stomper, Archangel of Wrath, and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. Support cards like Leyline Binding and Depopulate help control the board. The deck also includes ramp cards like Herd Migration and Up the Beanstalk to quickly bring out its big creatures. The mana base includes various lands to ensure consistent mana access. Overall, the deck aims to establish board control and overwhelm the opponent with its strong creatures.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay through a combination of powerful creatures and removal spells. It includes a variety of creatures with strong abilities and high power/toughness stats to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes a mix of lands to ensure the right color mana is available, as well as artifacts to provide additional benefits. The goal is to apply pressure early on and maintain board control throughout the game to secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to flood the board with aggressive creatures and control spells to quickly overwhelm your opponent. The deck focuses on efficient removal spells and powerful creatures to push through damage and disrupt your opponent's game plan. Utilizing a mix of aggressive creatures and powerful legendary creatures, along with a variety of lands to support the strategy, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and maintain control of the battlefield.

This deck focuses on aggressive play, utilizing a combination of creatures with powerful abilities and removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes a mix of legendary creatures and powerful spells to keep up pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a focus on quick, efficient creatures and targeted removal, this deck aims to put the opponent on the back foot from the start and maintain pressure until victory is achieved.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures that can quickly overwhelm the opponent while also utilizing solid removal spells to control the board. The deck prioritizes efficient creatures like Novice Inspector and Warden of the Inner Sky to apply early pressure, alongside powerful finishers like Voldaren Epicure and Resolute Reinforcements. With a mix of low-cost creatures and powerful spells like Gleeful Demolition, the deck aims to maintain board presence and close out games quickly. The lands in the deck are optimized for color consistency and to ensure smooth mana curve progression.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and combat tricks to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Using low-cost creatures like Novice Inspector and Warden of the Inner Sky to apply early pressure, alongside powerful finishers like Knight-Errant of Eos and Gleeful Demolition. The deck also includes cards like Resolute Reinforcements and Warleader's Call to buff your creatures and go wide on the board. With a mix of removal and evasion, this deck aims to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. The deck aims to control the game by countering threats, removing key creatures, and drawing into powerful spells to maintain board control. The mana base includes a variety of lands to ensure consistent color availability for spells and to provide flexibility in activating abilities. Key cards include counterspells like Deduce and Get Lost, removal spells like Lightning Helix, and card draw spells like Memory Deluge.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent by utilizing a variety of aggressive red spells and creatures. The goal is to establish early board presence with creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Slickshot Show-Off, while also using powerful burn spells like Lightning Strike and Obliterating Bolt to finish off opponents. Urabrask's Forge and Kumano Faces Kakkazan provide additional sources of damage, leading to a quick victory. Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance and Mishra's Foundry help provide consistent mana sources to fuel the aggressive strategy.

This Red Deck Wins archetype focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Monastery Swiftspear and Bloodthirsty Adversary provide early aggression, while Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Urabrask's Forge offer additional damage and board control. Feldon, Ronom Excavator can recur powerful creatures from the graveyard. Play with Fire and Lightning Strike provide direct damage, while Witchstalker Frenzy and Scorching Shot help to clear the opponent's board. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient threats and burn spells.

The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of control spells and powerful creatures to outmaneuver and overwhelm opponents. By utilizing cards like Memory Deluge and Ill-Timed Explosion to control the board, while also deploying threats like Nissa, Resurgent Animist and Colossal Skyturtle, the deck aims to maintain a strong presence on the battlefield. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Virtue of Strength and Worldsoul's Rage provide additional versatility and options for dealing with various threats. The deck's strategy is to keep the opponent on the back foot while slowly building towards a decisive victory.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to use a variety of cards to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck includes cards that allow for card draw, counterspells, removal, and board wipes to maintain control of the game. It also includes a few win conditions in the form of powerful creatures and planeswalkers. By controlling the game and outlasting the opponent, this deck aims to establish dominance and secure victory through tactical decision-making and strategic plays.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a variety of spells to manipulate the board state and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It includes cards that allow for card draw and selection, counterspells to prevent key plays by the opponent, and removal spells to deal with threats on the board. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by generating advantage through card advantage and resource denial, while ultimately establishing a dominant position on the battlefield. It also includes a small creature package to provide additional threats and defense if necessary.

This deck aims to control the game by countering and removing opponent's threats while drawing cards and gaining incremental advantage. It utilizes a combination of counter spells, removal spells, card draw, and board wipes to maintain control of the battlefield and grind out victories. Additionally, it includes various utility lands to help fix mana and disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck is designed to outlast opponents and win through attrition rather than aggressive tactics.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to control the board through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while establishing a strong board presence with powerful creatures like The Wandering Emperor. The deck utilizes a variety of control cards such as March of Otherworldly Light, Memory Deluge, and Three Steps Ahead to maintain control of the game. Additionally, it includes some lock-down cards like Temporary Lockdown and Depopulate to further limit the opponent's options. The deck aims to out-value and outlast the opponent through careful resource management and strategic plays.

This UW Control deck focuses on maintaining control of the game through card advantage and disruption. The deck utilizes a variety of spells to counter, remove, and manipulate the opponent's resources while drawing cards to maintain a full hand. With a mix of board wipes, counterspells, and card draw, the goal is to outlast the opponent and eventually win through incremental advantage. Utilizing lands like Field of Ruin and Restless Anchorage, the deck aims to control the battlefield and keep the opponent on the back foot until victory is achieved.
